Question: An ancient philosopher believed that it is good to understand reason through external means such as reading, but 'even if I don't know a word, I still need to be a dignified person.' The important thing is to first establish the fundamental principle of benevolence and righteousness. This thinker may be

The "Treatise on Reading the Comprehensive Mirror" says: "Those who strive for victory at both ends but only engage in useless arguments are those who distinguish feudalism. ____, after two thousand years, it has been difficult to change." The horizontal line in the sentence should be filled in
A: The system of prefectures and counties
